history.content: If you're under the 13 unit minimum required by L&S or 12 required by CoE, take that course for unit. Otherwise there's no reason to take courses for unit.
If you're under the 13 unit minimum required by L&S or 12 required by CoE, take more that course for unit. Otherwise there's no reason to take courses for unit.

children.subject: I would use P/NP class if either 1) I need raw units to get to the 13 required by the college and don't care if it's an easy Decal, 2) I need to clear a humanity requirement completely unrelated to my major, or 3) I need to clear a major requirement and use the COVID exception. As long as you stay under 1/3 P/NP it doesn't matter how much P/NP you use. For instance, some people just take a lot of research unit P/NP to meet their 13 minimum each semester.
Oh ok. Thanks a lot. Any advice on how many PNP units people generally use for Upper Divs?

history.content:
I've taken CSM 61A and CSM 16A for units and I plan to take CSM 61B and CSM 16B in Sp21 (second sem). But I don't know if getting two free units is worth using my 1/3 PNP limit for

Can someone advise me on this?

How many PNP units should I save for my 4th semester, 3rd year and 4th year?
history.subject: Should I take CSM for units?
